a.title: Front Entrance of Cloverdale Middle School

img.alt: Front Entrance of Cloverdale Middle School

p.span: I understand that the recent closure of schools has created many challenges for families in our community, however, I want to thank you for the understanding and support that families and community members have provided our students during this uncertain time. It is great to see everyone work together to make the best of a tough situation.
On Monday, April 13, the school board approved an amended calendar for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year. I have listed the details below:
April 13 – April 17 eLearning: Monday, Wednesday, Friday
April 20 – April 24 eLearning: Monday, Wednesday, Friday
April 27 – May 1 eLearning: Monday, Wednesday, Friday
May 4 – May 8 eLearning: Monday, Wednesday, Friday
May 11- May 15 eLearning: Monday, Wednesday, Friday

With this calendar, students will have been in session 163 days (160 required by IDOE) by a combination of: 142 days in school, 21 eLearning days (including two snow days), and 14 waiver days. So, Friday May 15, 2020, will be the last official student day for the 2019-20 school year.

I remain hopeful that at some point prior to the start of the next school year, CHS seniors will be able to participate in graduation, senior awards program, and the prom. Plans for each event continue to be discussed, however, state mandates will dictate the final outcome.

The grab and go breakfast and lunch program has been very successful with several of our families participating. As a reminder, beginning Monday, April 20, 2020, sacked breakfast and lunches will only be distributed on Mondays and Wednesdays from 10:30 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. providing meals for the entire week.

a.title: Medication Pick Up for April 16 is Postponed
